Rosario Davi

45 Manor Parkway · Lincroft, NJ 07738 · (908) 461-6288 · Rosariodavi9@gmail.com

My favorite thing to do in life is continuing to learn. As far as I can rememeber I was always picking up new things to learn. Besides playing many sports growing up, I started to learn how to play guitar while I was 13 years old. Many years later I decided to learn piano, and after that I wanted to learn drums. My passaion for learning has lead me to many things, but the two most imporant things are Jiu-Jitsu and Hack Reactor.

I discovered Jiu Jitsu in my early 20s, and been training for the passed 6 years. My passion for learning helped me progress quickly in the art, receiving my blue belt with in 10 months of training and a purple belt a few years later. Jiu Jitsu has taught me alot about myself. Practing the art has taught me perseverance, as well as discovering my passion to learn, teach and grow. Jiu Jitsu has been a big part of my life and oddly enough how I discovered a passion for software engineering.

I went to college for bussiness and finance, however, something always told me that was not where I belong. I graduated and shortly after went where any newly graduated bussiness student goes, Wall Street. This was where I was told to go my whole life to be succesful. I worked in a few financal/accoutanting jobs, but nothing was stimulating my desire to learn new skills. I did not know where I wanted to go, all I knew was I had three passion, learning, teaching, and growing. It wasnt till 3 years in an accoutant postion I heard of software engeering and Hack reactors program.

Experience

Junior Accountant

Wakefern Food Corp

Responsible for creating and uploading CSVs and handling any errors by troubleshooting. Processed minimum 300 invoices daily through OCR Coding Form including releasing invoices on hold. Independently handled the processing and projects for the SRS department.

December 2019 - July 2022

Associate Structured Funds Administration

Intermediate Capital Group

Monitored trades on ClearPar systems along with being responsible for allocations and closing trades. Tracked invoices using excel, followed with an email and phone call to receive money owed. Reconciled trades, Par vs Cash, Daily Cash, and Data attributes to internal and external parties using excel

January 2019 - May 2019

Security Master/Reorganization Associate

Oppenheimer

Operated Bloomberg terminal and onboarding securities though CUSIP, ISIN, and Sedal. Determineding securities class codes such as bond, municipal bond, etc. Handled creation of option folders and expiring options as well as REGs to 144a conversions.

October 2017 - January 2018
